text: The Foreign Affairs Select Committee is one of many select committees of the British House of Commons, which scrutinises the work of the Foreign, Commonwealth and Development Office. ==Inquiries== The Foreign Affairs Committee carries out many inquiries, and publishes a variety of reports, including an annual Human Rights Report. During its inquiry into the government's decision to invade Iraq, Dr. David Kelly famously gave evidence to the committee on 15 July 2003, two days before his death. In 2015 through 2016 the committee conducted an extensive and highly critical inquiry into the British involvement in the Libyan Civil War. It concluded that the early threat to civilians had been overstated and that the significant Islamist element in the rebel forces had not been recognised, due to an intelligence failure. By summer 2011 the initial limited intervention to protect Libyan civilians had become a policy of regime change. However that new policy did not include proper support and for a new government, leading to a political and economic collapse in Libya and the growth of ISIL in North Africa. The report concluded that the former Prime Minister David Cameron was ultimately responsible for this British policy failure. ==Membership== As of May 2020, the Committee's current members are as follows: {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="2" valign="top" | Member ! valign="top" | Party ! valign="top" | Constituency |- | bgcolor="" | | Tom Tugendhat MP (Chairman) | Conservative | Tonbridge and Malling |- | bgcolor="" | | Chris Bryant MP | Labour | Rhondda |- | bgcolor="" | | Neil Coyle MP | Labour | Bermondsey and Old Southwark |- | bgcolor="" | | Alicia Kearns MP | Conservative | Rutland and Melton |- | bgcolor="" | |Stewart M. McDonald MP | Scottish National Party | Glasgow South |- | bgcolor="" | | Claudia Webbe MP | Labour | Leicester East |- | bgcolor="" | | Andrew Rosindell MP | Conservative | Romford |- | bgcolor="" | | Bob Seely MP | Conservative | Isle of Wight |- | bgcolor="" | | Henry Smith MP | Conservative | Crawley |- | bgcolor="" | | Royston Smith MP | Conservative | Southampton Itchen |- | bgcolor="" | | Graham Stringer MP | Labour | Blackley and Broughton |} == Chair of the Foreign Affairs Select Committee == {| class="wikitable" ! colspan="2" |Chair !Party !Constituency !First elected !Method |- | style="background-color: " | |Tom Tugendhat |Conservative |Tonbridge and Malling |12 July 2017 |Elected by the House of Commons |- | style="background-color: " | |Crispin Blunt |Conservative |Reigate |18 June 2015 |Elected by the House of Commons |- | style="background-color: " | |Sir Richard Ottaway |Conservative |Croydon South |17 May 2010 |Elected by the House of Commons |- | style="background-color: " | |Mike Gapes |Labour |Ilford South |19 July 2005 |Elected by the Select Committee |- | style="background- color: " | |Donald Anderson |Labour |Swansea East |16 July 1997 |Elected by the Select Committee |- | style="background-color: " | |David Howell |Conservative |Guildford |1 January 1987 |Elected by the Select Committee |- | style="background-color: " | |Anthony Kershaw |Conservative |Stroud |1979 |Elected by the Select Committee |} == See also == *Parliamentary Committees of the United Kingdom ==References== ==External links== *Foreign Affairs Committee Category:Foreign and Commonwealth Office Category:Select Committees of the British House of Commons Category:Parliamentary committees on Foreign Affairs
